intro: Pseudolysimachion linariifolium var. dilatatum, commonly known as the broadleaf lysimachion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features slender, branched stems that rise from a rhizomatous base, often reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. The leaves are lanceolate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and are arranged alternately along the stem. Its small, clustered flowers are typically pink to purple in color, blooming in late summer. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
